{"step_by_step_thinking": "The infra temporal fossa is a region in the skull. According to Document [0], the prominent arteries present in the infra temporal fossa include the maxillary artery and associated branches, including the middle meningeal artery and accessory meningeal artery. The maxillary artery is the seventh branch of the external carotid artery. It courses through the infra temporal fossa. Therefore, the main arterial trunk supplying the infra temporal fossa is the maxillary artery.", "answer_choice": "C. Maxillary artery"}
